## Geo-Spatial Latency Arbitrage

<div align="center">
  <img src="images/Latency_Arbitrage.png" alt="Geo-Spatial Latency Arbitrage" class="project-image">
  <br>
  <a href="https://github.com/chayman7771/Quantisphere" target="_blank" class="gh-badge">
    <img src="https://img.shields.io/badge/View%20on-GitHub-24292f?logo=github&logoColor=white" alt="GitHub Repo Badge"> View Code
  </a>
</div>
<p align="center" class="project-desc">
  <em>
  Quantisphere is a cloud-native, microservice-driven platform for latency arbitrage. It streams 
  high-frequency market data via Kafka, stores it in Parquet (with optional kdb+ integration), and 
  drives real-time signal generation through Python-based machine learning models. The global latency 
  map and WebSocket dashboard visualize sub-millisecond cross-exchange spreads, while Prometheus and 
  Grafana provide observability and alerts across the full stack. The system is designed for precision 
  execution, scalability, and real-time optimization of arbitrage strategies.
  </em>
</p>
<p align="center"><strong>Tech Stack:</strong> Docker, Kubernetes, Kafka, AWS, Python, Postgres, Prometheus, Grafana, WebSockets, Parquet, kdb+</p>

## Monte Carlo, GARCH, ARIMA & Other Forecasting Models

<div align="center">
  <img src="images/Monte_Carlo_and_Forecasting.png" alt="Monte Carlo + GARCH Forecasting" class="project-image">
  <br>
  <a href="https://github.com/chayman7771/Forecasting-Models" target="_blank" class="gh-badge">
    <img src="https://img.shields.io/badge/View%20on-GitHub-24292f?logo=github&logoColor=white" alt="GitHub Repo Badge"> View Code
  </a>
</div>
<p align="center" class="project-desc">
  <em>
  Forecasting engine combining Monte Carlo simulation with GARCH, ARIMA, and other time-series models. 
  Built in R with ggplot2, it simulates equity price paths under stochastic volatility and visualizes 
  probabilistic outcomes with confidence intervals to support forward-looking risk and return analysis.
  </em>
</p>
<p align="center"><strong>Tech Stack:</strong> R, ggplot2, Monte Carlo Simulation, GARCH, ARIMA</p>
